Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs are 32-37 on the road this year, while the Nationals are 32-34 at home.
Chicago is coming off of a series against Pittsburgh, where their bats were on fire.
The Cubs are rolling right now and they have a big advantage on the mound.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs have won eight of their last nine road games against teams that held a losing record.
The Nationals have lost seven of their last eight night games against National League opponents.
Each of the Nationals' last six night games against National League opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Six of the Cubs' last seven road games against National League opponents have gone OVER the total runs line.
Others: Luis Garcia has scored at least one run in each of his last 10 Friday night appearances against teams that held a winning record.
Joey Gallo has recorded two or more RBIs in three of his last four appearances against the Cubs.
Keibert Ruiz has recorded at least one total base in each of his last eight appearances at Nationals Park against NL Central opponents that held a winning record.
Nico Hoerner has recorded at least one Single in seven of the Cubs' last eight night games against NL East opponents that held a losing record.
Dansby Swanson has hit a home run in each of the Cubs' last two night games against NL opponents that held a losing record.
